text: Héctor Rodríguez Castro (born March 26, 1982) is a Venezuelan lawyer and politician. He is currently the governor of Miranda. ==Political career== On 9 January 2014, he was appointed as Minister of Popular Power for Education until his dismissal on 4 September 2015 to be a candidate for deputy to the National Assembly of Venezuela. He was elected deputy list by the Bolívar state for the period 2016–2021 in the parliamentary elections of 6 December 2015 by the Great Patriotic Pole. He won the regional elections in Miranda in 2017. ==References== Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Venezuelan lawyers Category:Governors of Miranda (state) Category:Members of the National Assembly (Venezuela) Category:Central University of Venezuela alumni Category:United Socialist Party of Venezuela politicians
title: Héctor Rodríguez Castro
